name: Talk_Civ1
_source: speak;Ephraim;Good afternoon mister.|I take you've lived in these parts for a long time, haven't you?

speak;OldMan1;Aye, that I have.|Been sailing these waters since before you were born, I'd wager.|The fog out here...it's relentless.|Rolls in thick as wool, it does.|Many a sailor has met their end in these cursed mists.
speak;Ephraim;It must take great skill to navigate in such conditions.

speak;OldMan1;Skill, aye, and a bit of luck too.|We always kept torches burning, even in the daytime.|Light's your only friend when you can't see past your own bow.|Course, nowadays my sailing days are over.|These old bones need rest more than adventure.
speak;Ephraim;Your knowledge of these waters is impressive.|Have you noticed anything unusual lately?

speak;OldMan1;Funny you should ask...|The fog's been stranger than usual.|Thicker, darker... almost like it's got a mind of its own.|I don't like it one bit.|You watch yourself out there, young man.|The sea's not to be trifled with, especially now.
speak;Ephraim;I'll keep that in mind.|Thank you for the warning.
